intro: Viguiera ghiesbreghtii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, purple-pink flower heads. The plant produces composite flowers that consist of both ray and disc florets, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Viguiera ghiesbreghtii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
